posts.title: Librarians on Meaningful Books in Their LGBTQ Journeys
posts.text: In celebration of Pride Month, we asked NYPL staff members to tell us about a book that was a transformative part of their LGBTQ experience.

posts.title: Women Who Fight Back with Poetry
posts.text: Discover recently published poetry books by women who are challenging silences, and giving voices to women past and present.

posts.title: #RainbowReading: 30 Books for Pride Month
posts.text: The New York Public Library is celebrating 2018 LGBTQ Pride Month with a recommended book for each day of June. Follow #RainbowReading for daily reading recommendations.

posts.title: Queering Parents: Books About LGBTQ Parenting
posts.text: LGBTQ+ literature often explores difficult relationships between queer and trans people and their parents. But what about parents who are themselves queer or trans?

posts.title: Finding Home in Jeanette Winterson
posts.text: Jeanette Winterson, born in Manchester August 27, 1959, is an award winning and well-loved author in the UK and North America. I have read and re-read many of Winterson’s works, and it always feels like coming home.
